sen.j: 柳原 資明（やなぎわら すけあきら、永仁5年（1297年） - 文和2年/正平 (日本)8年（1353年）7月27日 (旧暦)）は、南北朝時代 (日本)の公卿で、柳原家の祖。
sen.e: Sukeakira YANAGIWARA (1297 – July 27, 1353) was a court noble in the Southern and Northern Dynasties Period (Japan) and the founder of the Yanagiwara family.

sen.e: He was the fourth son of Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) Toshimitsu HINO, who was the regent for the In no cho (Retired Emperor's Office) of Emperor Gofushimi.

sen.j: 正安3年に従五位下に叙任され、文保元年21歳で花園天皇の蔵人に任じられて以後は、専ら持明院統系の天皇・太上天皇に仕えた。
sen.e: He was appointed Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in 1301, and in after being appointed as kurodo (Chamberlain) to Emperor Hanazono in 1317 at the age of 21, he worked exclusively for the Jimyo-in line (imperial lineage from Emperor Gofukakusa to Emperor Gokomatsu) Emperors and Daijotenno (retired Emperor).

sen.j: 後に弁官・左大弁・参議を歴任後、光厳天皇のもとで正三位中納言にまで上るが、鎌倉幕府滅亡後、復位した後醍醐天皇によって昇進人事を無効とされると、建武の新政に激しく反発した。
sen.e: After being Benkan (Oversight Department: division of the daijokan responsible for controlling central and provincial governmental offices), Sadaiben (Major Controller of the Left), and Sangi (Royal Advisor), he climbed to the position of Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) Chunagon (Middle Counselor) under Emperor Kogon, but after the decline of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), promotional job assignments were made invalid by the reinstated Emperor Godaigo and therefore he became a strong opponent of the Kenmu Restoration.

sen.j: 足利尊氏によって光明天皇が擁立されると、改めて権中納言に任じられて、以後北朝 (日本)の有能な実務官僚として活躍した。
sen.e: When Emperor Komyo ascended the throne under Takauji ASHIKAGA, he was reinstated as Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor) and later played an active role as a skilled administrative bureaucrat.

sen.j: 建武 (日本)4年（延元3年）、権大納言に上った。

sen.e: He retired in 1346, but 2 years later he became In no betto (chief administrator of the Retired Emperor's Office) for retired Emperor Komyo, and after the Kanno Disturbance, for Emperor Suko.
